title: Welcome to the Lab
text:
This project analyzes biomechanics data from the OpenBiomechanics Project, an open-source initiative by Driveline Baseball.
The data is captured in their motion capture lab using high-speed cameras and reflective markers placed on the athlete’s body. This allows for sub-millimeter accuracy in tracking joint centers and skeletal movement.


Below is a video directly from the Driveline lab showing how the capture system works:

title: Welcome to the Lab
text:
About This Site
I built this site to correlate body kinematics (how they move) with pitch metrics (how the ball flies).
Navigate to the analysis tabs to see: * Hip-Shoulder Separation: Does stretching the core lead to more velocity? * Arm Stress: Which mechanics put the most torque on the elbow?

title: About The Project
text:

make sure they work!
